moves.1... e5: i decided to go a bit more mainstream than usual
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: really i couldn't be less exited in the opening
moves.3... Nf6 4. d3 Bc5 5. Be3 Bxe3 6. fxe3: after that bishop exchange i was very afraid of white getting a very strong centre
moves.6... Ng4: i did this to try and intimidate my opponent, to really try to make him scared
moves.7. Qd2 Ne7: i send my knighton a trip across the board, a tall order when your opponent owns the centre
i made this move withb the aim of bg4 eventually winning a rook for a bishop
moves.14. g4: this move puzzled me it gives away a pawn even if my bishop wasn't there
i deide on a queen exchange
moves.24. Qxa5 Rxa5 25. Nd6 Ra6 26. Nxb7: carlessly giving away a pawn but i thought that it would be usless anway, i was a rook up
moves.29... Nxf2 30. Nb4 h5: follish move but i didn't care i was a rook up...for now
moves.31. Nxd5 g5: the biggest blunder i did the entire game and coincidental the bluner that won me the game
moves.32. Ne7+: this move spelt my victory an eleven point blunder... but not in a bad sense
moves.32... Kg7 33. Nxc8: at this point i almost resigned, but i realised things wern't that bad and infact i had won
moves.33... gxh4 34. Nd6: relising the king couldn't stop it he tried the knight but that was doomed from the start
moves.34... h3 35. Nf5+ Kg6 36. Ng3: seems lost well actualy it doesn't its an obvious win for white
moves.37... h4 38. Nh1: miscalcutation. probably thought he had enough time to promote
moves.40... h1=Q+: my win. because i blundered of a rook i was up 11 points
